title: Frequently Asked Questions on Voting by Mail | WA Secretary of State
snippet: Washington votes by mail every election. If you are registered to vote in Washington, there is no need to request a ballot. Confirm your registration at VoteWA.gov. Voting by mail is convenient and gives you time to learn about the ballot measures and candidates before casting your vote.

title: Washington Absentee Ballots - Vote.org
snippet: Absentee ballots will automatically be sent to all registered voters. If you need your ballot sent somewhere other than your usual address, contact your local election official at least one month before the election so you have time to receive the ballot.
